intro: Rodriguezia microphyta, commonly known as the dwarf rodriguezia, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are typically less than 5 centimeters in length. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, white flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its fruit is a small, round berry that contains several seeds. Due to its ornamental value and unique foliage, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
